title: Samples of Anonymised Records at the Cathie Marsh Centre for Census and Survey Research
abstractText:
The project provides a programme of support for Samples of Anonymised Records (SARs) and other individual or household data files from the 1991 and 2001 Censuses.

  • The SARs teams serves a variety of roles, including: 
    Providing access to the following U.K data through a variety of media and in a various formats. 1991 2 per cent Individual SAR, 1991 1 per cent Household SAR, 2001 3 per cent Individual Licensed SAR, 2001 1 per cent Household SAR (England and Wales only, under Special Licence), 2001 5 per cent Small Area Microdata file.

  • Providing user support and training

  • The promotion of data and the provision of information through outreach activities.

  • Monitoring the use of SAR files and their research impact

  • Working with the Office for National Statistics (ONS) in the development of microdata samples from the 2011 census and consulting users about this process.

  • Adding value to existing datasets by deriving new variables and developing user documentation.

  • Promoting use of SARs in teaching through the development of further teaching datasets and materials.

  • Supporting use of more detailed Controlled Access Microdata files in collaboration with ONS Access to and further information about the data is provided at the sars website: http://www.ccsr.ac.uk/sars/
